desc: What do self-determination and cultural identity mean for Native American peoples today? Students examine the impact of colonization on Native American peoples, including federal policies, treaty rights and sovereignty. Issues include economy and politics on reservations, family and gender roles, orality and literacy, persistence and revitalization of religious life and culture, urban life and recent social movements and organizations. Offered Fall or Spring Semester.
name: Contemp Native Am
title: Contemporary Native American Issues
